span: The Span Receipts Index pairs each span of text with provenance metadata so analysts can audit how a response was assembled.

left.text: Each record includes a semantic embedding, structural fingerprints, and the originating corpus path.

right.text: This example corpus models an operational handbook describing how the SRI pipeline is deployed inside a neutral environment.

span: When onboarding a new corpus, start with a narrow subset that captures the intended retrieval style.

left.text: Run the SRI membership benchmark to ensure high recall for known spans, then review the structural and semantic twin outputs for confusing near-miss content.

right.text: Calibrate the admission gate only after the SBI metrics are stable; otherwise the thresholds will chase noisy spans rather than useful receipts.

span: The support rotation monitors the /seen route for latency regressions and verifies that /sbi answers include linkable receipts.

left.text: Every incident ticket must identify the manifest build used to serve the responses.

right.text: Rolling back to a previous pack requires rebuilding the bloom filter and reindexing contexts, both of which are automated via the sbi-bench target in the Makefile.
